title: Ensemble GI
authors: Yifeng Gao, Jessica Lin, Constantin Brif

parameters.name: anomaly_window_size
parameters.description: The size of the sliding window, in which `w` regions are made discrete.

parameters.name: n_estimators
parameters.description: The number of models in the ensemble.

parameters.name: max_paa_transform_size
parameters.description: Maximum size of the embedding space used by PAA (SAX word size `w`)

parameters.name: max_alphabet_size
parameters.description: Maximum number of symbols used for discretization by SAX (`\alpha`)

parameters.name: selectivity
parameters.description: The fraction of models in the ensemble included in the end result.

parameters.name: random_state
parameters.description: Seed for the random number generator

parameters.name: n_jobs
parameters.description: The number of parallel jobs to use for executing the models. If `-1`, then the number of jobs is set to the number of CPU cores.

parameters.name: window_method
parameters.description: Windowing method used to create subsequences. The original implementation had a strange method (`orig`) that is similar to `tumbling`, the paper uses a `sliding` window. However, `sliding` is significantly slower than `tumbling` while producing better results (higher anomaly score resolution). `orig` should not be used!
